quiz.title: Physics Grade 11: Kinematics - Multi-Stage Motion
quiz.subtitle: Unit 1 Quiz 2: Motion Graphs & Multi-Stage Problems (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A car starts from rest and accelerates uniformly at 2 m/s² for 10 seconds. It then travels at constant speed for 20 seconds before decelerating uniformly to rest in 5 seconds. What is the car's maximum speed?
questions.explanation: Stage 1: v = u + at = 0 + (2)(10) = 20 m/s. This is the maximum speed since it's constant in stage 2.

questions.question: For the same car (acceleration 2 m/s² for 10 s, constant speed 20 s, deceleration to rest in 5 s), what is the total displacement?
questions.explanation: Stage 1: s₁ = ½at² = ½(2)(10²) = 100 m. Stage 2: s₂ = vt = 20×20 = 400 m. Stage 3: s₃ = average speed×time = 10×5 = 50 m. Total = 100+400+50 = 550 m.

questions.question: A cyclist travels at 6 m/s for 8 s, accelerates at 1.5 m/s² for 4 s, then decelerates to rest in 3 s. What is the total distance traveled?
A subway train accelerates at 0.8 m/s² for 12 s, maintains constant speed for 45 s, then decelerates at 1 m/s² until stopping. What is the distance between stations?
A jogger runs at 4 m/s for 15 s, accelerates to 6 m/s over 5 s, maintains 6 m/s for 10 s, then decelerates to rest in 4 s. What is the total displacement?
questions.explanation: Stage 1: 4×15 = 60 m. Stage 2: average speed = 5 m/s; s = 5×5 = 25 m. Stage 3: 6×10 = 60 m. Stage 4: average speed = 3 m/s; s = 3×4 = 12 m. Total = 60+25+60+12 = 157 m.

questions.question: A truck moving at 12 m/s accelerates at 1.2 m/s² for 8 s, travels at constant speed for 15 s, then brakes to rest in 6 s. What is the total distance covered from acceleration start?
A ball rolls down an incline from rest, accelerating at 1.5 m/s² for 6 s, then constant speed for 8 s, then decelerates at 2 m/s² to rest. Total distance?
A motorcyclist travels at 18 m/s for 10 s, accelerates at 2 m/s² for 5 s, maintains speed for 12 s, then decelerates to rest in 4 s. What is the final maximum speed reached?
questions.explanation: After acceleration: v = 18 + 2×5 = 28 m/s. This is maintained in stage 3, so it's the final maximum speed before deceleration.

questions.question: For the same motorcyclist (18 m/s for 10 s, accelerate 2 m/s² for 5 s, constant speed 12 s, decelerate to rest in 4 s), what is the total displacement?
A car at 25 m/s brakes to 15 m/s in 4 s, travels at 15 m/s for 8 s, then accelerates back to 25 m/s in 5 s. What is the total displacement in this 17 s period?
questions.explanation: Stage 1: average speed = 20 m/s; s = 20×4 = 80 m. Stage 2: 15×8 = 120 m. Stage 3: average speed = 20 m/s; s = 20×5 = 100 m. Total = 80+120+100 = 300 m.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered multi-stage motion calculations.
scoreMessages.70: Very good! You understand kinematics concepts. Review acceleration/deceleration formulas.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice breaking complex motion into stages.
scoreMessages.0: Review basic kinematics equations and motion graphs.
